samples.name: Basic GeoMap
samples.description: A ‘GeoMap’ is useful for displaying points of interest, area objects or other charts above the map.

samples.name: Basic AnalyticMap
samples.description: An ‘analytic map’ is useful for displaying quantitative or qualitative data by coloring various regions.

samples.name: GeoMap with Labels
samples.description: Use a ‘label’ to provide more information about a symbol or standalone with an anchor.

samples.name: AnalyticMap with Labels
samples.description: Use a ‘label’ to provide more information about a symbol or standalone with an anchor.

samples.name: AnalyticMap with Spots
samples.description: Use ‘spots’ to visualize specific locations on the map.

samples.name: AnalyticMap with Circles
samples.description: Use ‘circles’ to visualize specific, quantitative parameters.

samples.name: AnalyticMap with Containers
samples.description: Use ‘containers’ to display an arbitrary SAP UI5 control on the map.

samples.name: GeoMap with Spots
samples.description: Use ‘spots’ to visualize specific locations on the map.

samples.name: GeoMap with Circles
samples.description: Use ‘circles’ to visualize specific, quantitative parameters.

samples.name: AnalyticMap with Regions
samples.description: You can visualize regions, such as countries or zip code zones.

samples.name: GeoMap with Containers
samples.description: Use ‘containers’ to display an arbitrary SAP UI5 control on the map.

samples.name: GeoMap with Areas
samples.description: Use ‘areas’ to visualize personalized areas, for example for visualizing regions such as countries or zip code zones.

samples.name: GeoMap with Street level Routes
samples.description: You can visualize ‘routes’ on a street level.

samples.name: GeoMap with High level Routes
samples.description: You can visualize ‘routes’ with showing the direct connection between two or more points of interest.
